protossl.h
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 /*H*************************************************************************************************/
2 /*!
3 
4  \File protossl.h
5 
6  \Description
7  This module is a from-scratch SSL2 implementation in order to avoid
8  any intellectual property issues. The SSL2 algorithm was implemented
9  from a specification provided by Netscape. Netscape has issued the
10  statement included below regarding the use of this algorithm:
11 
12  \Notes
13  Netscape Communications Corporation has been issued the following
14  patent in the United States:
15 
16  Secure Socket Layer Application Program Apparatus And Method
17  ("SSL"), No. 5,657,390
18 
19  Netscape Communications has issued the following statement:
20 
21  Intellectual Property Rights
22 
23  Secure Sockets Layer
24 
25  The United States Patent and Trademark Office ("the PTO")
26  recently issued U.S. Patent No. 5,657,390 ("the SSL Patent") to
27  Netscape for inventions described as Secure Sockets Layers
28  ("SSL"). The IETF is currently considering adopting SSL as a
29  transport protocol with security features. Netscape encourages
30  the royalty-free adoption and use of the SSL protocol upon the
31  following terms and conditions:
32 
33  * If you already have a valid SSL Ref license today which
34  includes source code from Netscape, an additional patent
35  license under the SSL patent is not required.
36 
37  * If you don't have an SSL Ref license, you may have a royalty
38  free license to build implementations covered by the SSL
39  Patent Claims or the IETF TLS specification provided that you
40  do not to assert any patent rights against Netscape or other
41  companies for the implementation of SSL or the IETF TLS
42  recommendation.
43 
44  What are "Patent Claims":
45 
46  Patent claims are claims in an issued foreign or domestic patent
47  that:
48 
49  1) must be infringed in order to implement methods or build
50  products according to the IETF TLS specification; or
51 
52  2) patent claims which require the elements of the SSL patent
53  claims and/or their equivalents to be infringed.
54 
55  \Copyright
56  Copyright (c) Tiburon Entertainment / Electronic Arts 2002. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.
57 
58  \Version 1.0 03/08/2002 (GWS) First Version
59  \Version 1.1 11/18/2002 (JLB) Names changed to include "Proto"
60 
61 */
62 /*************************************************************************************************H*/
63 
64 #ifndef _protossl_h
65 #define _protossl_h
66 
67 /*!
68 \Moduledef ProtoSSL ProtoSSL
69 \Modulemember Proto
70 */
71 //@{
72 
73 /*** Include files *********************************************************************/
74 
75 #include "DirtySDK/platform.h"
76 
77 /*** Defines ***************************************************************************/
78 
79 // supported SSL/TLS versions
80 #define PROTOSSL_VERSION_SSLv3 (0x0300)
81 #define PROTOSSL_VERSION_TLS1_0 (0x0301)
82 #define PROTOSSL_VERSION_TLS1_1 (0x0302)
83 #define PROTOSSL_VERSION_TLS1_2 (0x0303)
84 
85 // protossl failure codes (retrieve with ProtoSSLStat('fail')
86 #define PROTOSSL_ERROR_NONE ( 0) //!< no error
87 #define PROTOSSL_ERROR_DNS (-1) //!< DNS failure
88 #define PROTOSSL_ERROR_CONN (-10) //!< TCP connection failure
89 #define PROTOSSL_ERROR_CONN_SSL2 (-11) //!< connection attempt was using unsupported SSLv2 record format
90 #define PROTOSSL_ERROR_CONN_NOTSSL (-12) //!< connection attempt was not recognized as SSL
91 #define PROTOSSL_ERROR_CONN_MINVERS (-13) //!< request failed minimum protocol version restriction
92 #define PROTOSSL_ERROR_CONN_MAXVERS (-14) //!< request failed maximum protocol version restriction
93 #define PROTOSSL_ERROR_CONN_NOCIPHER (-15) //!< no supported cipher
94 #define PROTOSSL_ERROR_CERT_INVALID (-20) //!< certificate invalid
95 #define PROTOSSL_ERROR_CERT_HOST (-21) //!< certificate not issued to this host
96 #define PROTOSSL_ERROR_CERT_NOTRUST (-22) //!< certificate is not trusted (recognized)
97 #define PROTOSSL_ERROR_CERT_MISSING (-23) //!< certificate not provided in certificate message
98 #define PROTOSSL_ERROR_CERT_BADDATE (-24) //!< certificate date range validity check failed
99 #define PROTOSSL_ERROR_CERT_REQUEST (-25) //!< CA fetch request failed
100 #define PROTOSSL_ERROR_SETUP (-30) //!< failure in secure setup
101 #define PROTOSSL_ERROR_SECURE (-31) //!< failure in secure connection after setup
102 #define PROTOSSL_ERROR_UNKNOWN (-32) //!< unknown failure
103 
104 // supported cipher suites
105 #define PROTOSSL_CIPHER_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA (1)
106 #define PROTOSSL_CIPHER_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_MD5 (2)
107 #define PROTOSSL_CIPHER_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA (4)
108 #define PROTOSSL_CIPHER_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA (8)
109 // the following cipher suites are TLS1.2+ only
110 #define PROTOSSL_CIPHER_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256 (16)
111 #define PROTOSSL_CIPHER_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA256 (32)
112 #define PROTOSSL_CIPHER_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256 (64)
113 #define PROTOSSL_CIPHER_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384 (128)
114 
115 //! all cipher suites
116 #define PROTOSSL_CIPHER_ALL (\
117  PROTOSSL_CIPHER_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA|PROTOSSL_CIPHER_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_MD5|\
118  PROTOSSL_CIPHER_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA|PROTOSSL_CIPHER_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA|\
119  PROTOSSL_CIPHER_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256|PROTOSSL_CIPHER_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA256|\
120  PROTOSSL_CIPHER_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256|PROTOSSL_CIPHER_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384)
121 
122 // client cert flags (ProtoSSLControl() 'ccrt' selector)
123 #define PROTOSSL_CLIENTCERT_NONE (0)
124 #define PROTOSSL_CLIENTCERT_OPTIONAL (1)
125 #define PROTOSSL_CLIENTCERT_REQUIRED (2)
126 
127 // clienthello extensions
128 #define PROTOSSL_HELLOEXTN_NONE (0)
129 #define PROTOSSL_HELLOEXTN_SERVERNAME (1)
130 #define PROTOSSL_HELLOEXTN_SIGALGS (2)
131 #define PROTOSSL_HELLOEXTN_ALPN (4)
132 // all extensions
133 #define PROTOSSL_HELLOEXTN_ALL (\
134  PROTOSSL_HELLOEXTN_SERVERNAME|PROTOSSL_HELLOEXTN_SIGALGS|PROTOSSL_HELLOEXTN_ALPN)
135 // default extensions
136 #define PROTOSSL_HELLOEXTN_DEFAULT (PROTOSSL_HELLOEXTN_ALL)
137

140 /*** Type Definitions ******************************************************************/
141 
142 //! identity fields for X509 issuer/subject
143 typedef struct ProtoSSLCertIdentT
144 {
145  char strCountry[32];
146  char strState[32];
147  char strCity[32];
148  char strOrg[32];
149  char strUnit[256];
150  char strCommon[64];
151 } ProtoSSLCertIdentT;
152 
153 //! alert info, returned by ProtoSSLStat() 'alrt' selector after an SSL alert has been received
154 typedef struct ProtoSSLAlertDescT
155 {
156  int32_t iAlertType;
157  const char *pAlertDesc;
158 } ProtoSSLAlertDescT;
159 
160 //! cert info, returned by ProtoSSLStat() 'cert' selector after certificate failure
161 typedef struct ProtoSSLCertInfoT
162 {
163  ProtoSSLCertIdentT Ident;
164  int32_t iKeyModSize;
165 } ProtoSSLCertInfoT;
166 
167 // opaque module state ref
168 typedef struct ProtoSSLRefT ProtoSSLRefT;

182 DIRTYCODE_API void ProtoSSLShutdown(void);

186 
187 // reset connection back to base state.

189 
190 // destroy the module and release its state
191 DIRTYCODE_API void ProtoSSLDestroy(ProtoSSLRefT *pState);
192 
193 // give time to module to do its thing (should be called periodically to allow module to perform work)
194 DIRTYCODE_API void ProtoSSLUpdate(ProtoSSLRefT *pState);
195 
196 // Accept an incoming connection.
197 DIRTYCODE_API ProtoSSLRefT* ProtoSSLAccept(ProtoSSLRefT *pState, int32_t iSecure, struct sockaddr *pAddr, int32_t *pAddrlen);
198 
199 // Create a socket bound to the given address.
200 DIRTYCODE_API int32_t ProtoSSLBind(ProtoSSLRefT *pState, const struct sockaddr *pAddr, int32_t pAddrlen);
201 
202 // make a secure connection to a server.
203 DIRTYCODE_API int32_t ProtoSSLConnect(ProtoSSLRefT *pState, int32_t iSecure, const char *pAddr, uint32_t uAddr, int32_t iPort);
204 
205 // disconnect from the server.
206 DIRTYCODE_API int32_t ProtoSSLDisconnect(ProtoSSLRefT *pState);
207 
208 // Start listening for an incoming connection.
209 DIRTYCODE_API int32_t ProtoSSLListen(ProtoSSLRefT *pState, int32_t iBacklog);
210 
211 // send secure data to the server.
212 DIRTYCODE_API int32_t ProtoSSLSend(ProtoSSLRefT *pState, const char *pBuffer, int32_t iLength);
213 
214 // receive secure data from the server.
215 DIRTYCODE_API int32_t ProtoSSLRecv(ProtoSSLRefT *pState, char *pBuffer, int32_t iLength);
216 
217 // return the current module status (according to selector)
218 DIRTYCODE_API int32_t ProtoSSLStat(ProtoSSLRefT *pState, int32_t iSelect, void *pBuffer, int32_t iLength);
219 
220 // control module behavior
221 DIRTYCODE_API int32_t ProtoSSLControl(ProtoSSLRefT *pState, int32_t iSelect, int32_t iValue, int32_t iValue2, void *pValue);
222 
223 // add an X.509 CA certificate that will be recognized in future transactions
224 DIRTYCODE_API int32_t ProtoSSLSetCACert(const uint8_t *pCACert, int32_t iCertSize);
225 
226 // same as ProtoSSLSetCACert(), but certs are not validated at load time
227 DIRTYCODE_API int32_t ProtoSSLSetCACert2(const uint8_t *pCACert, int32_t iCertSize);
228 
229 // validate all CAs that have not already been validated
230 DIRTYCODE_API int32_t ProtoSSLValidateAllCA(void);
231 
232 // clear all CA certs
233 DIRTYCODE_API void ProtoSSLClrCACerts(void);
234

236 }
